meanings.definition: To obscure the light from or to (another celestial body)
meanings.sent1: The moon was eclipsing the sun during the solar eclipse.
meanings.sent2: The tall building was eclipsing the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cloud was eclipsing the sun, playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing was eclipsing all the other performers on stage.
meanings.sent5: The dense fog was eclipsing the entire city, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Her kindness was eclipsing his selfishness in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent2: The new model of the car was eclipsing the previous version in sales.
meanings.sent3: The student's enthusiasm for learning was eclipsing the teacher's expectations.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence was eclipsing all his classmates, making him stand out.
meanings.sent5: The bright star was eclipsing all the others in the night sky, shining the brightest.

meanings.sent1: The moon was eclipsing as it passed behind the Earth's shadow.
meanings.sent2: The planet was eclipsing as it moved into the shadow of its moon.
meanings.sent3: The clock tower was eclipsing at noon, surprising the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: The sun was eclipsing behind the clouds, casting a shadow over the land.
meanings.sent5: The star was eclipsing as it was blocked by a passing asteroid, disappearing momentarily.
